messages.content: You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: NuCore Smart Air Purifier
  ***Properties***
    Air Quality Index
      Range 0 to 500 Unit AQI (step of 1 and precision of 0).
    Fan Speed
      Enum
        Low [1]
        Medium [2]
        High [3]
        Auto [4]
    Filter Life
      Range 0 to 100 Unit Percent (step of 1 and precision of 0).
    Power State
      Enum
        Off [0]
        On [1]
  ***Accept Commands***
    Set Fan Speed [SFANS]
        Parameter 1:  []
          Enum
            Low [1]
            Medium [2]
            High [3]
            Auto [4]
    Power On/Off [PWR]
        Parameter 1:  []
          Enum
            Off [0]
            On [1]

USER QUERY:
Can you turn on the air purifier and set the fan speed to high?

First, I review the device properties and commands. The device has a Power State property with values Off [0] and On [1], and a Fan Speed property with values Low [1], Medium [2], High [3], and Auto [4]. The accepted commands include Power On/Off [PWR] and Set Fan Speed [SFANS], both requiring enum parameters matching these values.

To turn on the air purifier, I will send the Power On/Off command with parameter On [1]. Then, to set the fan speed to high, I will send the Set Fan Speed command with parameter High [3].

Result: Execute PWR with parameter 1 (On) to power on the device, then execute SFANS with parameter 3 (High) to set the fan speed to high.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: NuCore Smart Air Purifier
  ***Properties***
    Air Quality Index
      Range 0 to 500 Unit AQI (step of 1 and precision of 0).
    Fan Speed

        Medium [2]
        High [3]
        Auto [4]
    Filter Life
      Range 0 to 100 Unit Percent (step of 1 and precision of 0).
    Power State
      Enum
        Off [0]
        On [1]
  ***Accept Commands***
    Set Fan Speed [SFANS]
        Parameter 1:  []
          Enum
            Low [1]
            Medium [2]
            High [3]
            Auto [4]
    Power On/Off [PWR]
        Parameter 1:  []
          Enum
            Off [0]
            On [1]

USER QUERY:
What is the current air quality index and how much filter life is left?

I look at the device properties relevant to the query: Air Quality Index ranges from 0 to 500 AQI, and Filter Life ranges from 0 to 100 percent. Both are read-only properties that provide current status.

Since the user wants to know the current air quality index and remaining filter life, I would retrieve these property values from the device's sensors or status reports.

Result: The current Air Quality Index is reported as the device's AQI value (0-500), and the Filter Life is reported as a percentage (0-100%). These values indicate the air quality level and how much usable filter remains.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: NuCore Smart Air Purifier
  ***Properties***
    Air Quality Index
      Range 0 to 500 Unit AQI (step of 1 and precision of 0).
    Fan Speed
      Enum
        Low [1]
        Medium [2]
        High [3]
        Auto [4]
    Filter Life
      Range 0 to 100 Unit Percent (step of 1 and precision of 0).
    Power State
      Enum
        Off [0]
        On [1]
  ***Accept Commands***
    Set Fan Speed [SFANS]
        Parameter 1:  []
          Enum
            Low [1]
            Medium [2]
            High [3]
            Auto [4]
    Power On/Off [PWR]
        Parameter 1:  []
          Enum
            Off [0]
            On [1]

USER QUERY:
Please set the fan speed to auto mode and turn off the purifier.

The device accepts commands to set fan speed and power state. Fan Speed can be set to Low [1], Medium [2], High [3], or Auto [4]. Power State can be Off [0] or On [1].

The user wants to set fan speed to Auto and turn off the purifier. Since the purifier must be powered off, the fan speed setting will not be active, but the command can still be sent to set the preferred fan speed for when powered on.

Step 1: Send Set Fan Speed [SFANS] command with parameter Auto [4].
Step 2: Send Power On/Off [PWR] command with parameter Off [0].

Result: Execute SFANS with 4 (Auto) and then PWR with 0 (Off) to fulfill the request.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: NuCore Smart Thermostat
  ***Properties***
    Temperature
      Range -10.0 to 50.0 Unit Celsius (step of 0.1 and precision of 1).
    Heat Setpoint
      Range 5 to 30 Unit Celsius (step of 0.5 and precision of 1).
    Cool Setpoint
      Range 5 to 30 Unit Celsius (step of 0.5 and precision of 1).
    Mode
      Enum
        Off [0]
        Heat [1]
        Cool [2]
        Auto [3]
        Fan Only [4]
    Fan Mode
      Enum
        Auto [0]
        On [1]
    Humidity
      Range 0 to 100 Unit Percent (step of 1 and precision of 0).
  ***Accept Commands***
    Heat Setpoint [CLISPH]
        Parameter 1:  []
          Range 5 to 30 Unit Celsius (step of 0.5 and precision of 1).
    Cool Setpoint [CLISPC]
        Parameter 1:  []
          Range 5 to 30 Unit Celsius (step of 0.5 and precision of 1).
    Mode [CLIMD]
        Parameter 1:  []
          Enum
            Off [0]
            Heat [1]
            Cool [2]
            Auto [3]
            Fan Only [4]
    Fan Mode [CLIFS]
        Parameter 1:  []
          Enum
            Auto [0]
            On [1]

USER QUERY:
I want to set the thermostat to cool mode and set the cool setpoint to 22.5 degrees Celsius. How do I do that?

The device supports setting the Mode property with values Off [0], Heat [1], Cool [2], Auto [3], and Fan Only [4]. The accepted command for mode is Mode [CLIMD].

The Cool Setpoint property ranges from 5 to 30 degrees Celsius with 0.5 increments, and the command to set it is Cool Setpoint [CLISPC].

Step 1: Send the Mode [CLIMD] command with parameter Cool [2] to switch the thermostat to cool mode.
Step 2: Send the Cool Setpoint [CLISPC] command with parameter 22.5 to set the desired cooling temperature.

Result: Execute CLIMD with 2 (Cool) and then CLISPC with 22.5 to set the thermostat accordingly.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

        Parameter 1:  []

USER QUERY:
What is the current humidity and temperature in the room?

The device properties include Temperature ranging from -10.0 to 50.0 degrees Celsius with 0.1 step and 1 decimal precision, and Humidity ranging from 0 to 100 percent with integer precision.

To answer the user's query, I would retrieve the current values of Temperature and Humidity from the device's sensors.

Result: The current room temperature is reported in degrees Celsius with one decimal place, and the humidity is reported as a percentage between 0 and 100%.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

USER QUERY:
Can you switch the fan mode to On and set the heat setpoint to 24.0 degrees Celsius?

The device accepts commands to set Fan Mode and Heat Setpoint. Fan Mode can be Auto [0] or On [1], and Heat Setpoint ranges from 5 to 30 degrees Celsius in 0.5 increments.

Step 1: Send Fan Mode [CLIFS] command with parameter On [1] to switch the fan mode to On.
Step 2: Send Heat Setpoint [CLISPH] command with parameter 24.0 to set the heating temperature.

Result: Execute CLIFS with 1 (On) and then CLISPH with 24.0 to apply the requested settings.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: NuCore Smart Light
  ***Properties***
    Brightness
      Range 0 to 100 Unit Percent (step of 1 and precision of 0).
    Color Temperature
      Range 2700 to 6500 Unit Kelvin (step of 100 and precision of 0).
    Power State
      Enum
        Off [0]
        On [1]
  ***Accept Commands***
    Set Brightness [SETBR]
        Parameter 1:  []
          Range 0 to 100 Unit Percent (step of 1 and precision of 0).
    Set Color Temperature [SETCT]
        Parameter 1:  []
          Range 2700 to 6500 Unit Kelvin (step of 100 and precision of 0).
    Power On/Off [PWR]
        Parameter 1:  []
          Enum
            Off [0]
            On [1]

USER QUERY:
I want to brighten the living room light to 75% and set the color temperature to 4000 Kelvin. How can I do that?

The device properties include Brightness from 0 to 100 percent and Color Temperature from 2700 to 6500 Kelvin in 100 K steps. The accepted commands are Set Brightness [SETBR], Set Color Temperature [SETCT], and Power On/Off [PWR].

Step 1: Use the Set Brightness [SETBR] command with parameter 75 to set brightness to 75%.
Step 2: Use the Set Color Temperature [SETCT] command with parameter 4000 to set the color temperature.

Result: Execute SETBR with 75 and SETCT with 4000 to adjust the living room light as requested.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

***Device***

  ***Accept Commands***
    Set Brightness [SETBR]
        Parameter 1:  []
          Range 0 to 100 Unit Percent (step of 1 and precision of 0).
    Set Color Temperature [SETCT]
        Parameter 1:  []
          Range 2700 to 6500 Unit Kelvin (step of 100 and precision of 0).
    Power On/Off [PWR]
        Parameter 1:  []
          Enum
            Off [0]
            On [1]

USER QUERY:
Is the bedroom light currently on, and what is its brightness level?

The device has a Power State property with values Off [0] and On [1], and a Brightness property ranging from 0 to 100 percent.

To answer the user's question, I would check the current Power State to determine if the light is on or off, and then read the Brightness property to find the current brightness level.

Result: The bedroom light's power state is either On or Off, and its brightness is reported as a percentage between 0 and 100%.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

***Device***

USER QUERY:
Turn off the kitchen light, please.

The device accepts a Power On/Off [PWR] command with parameters Off [0] and On [1]. To turn off the kitchen light, I will send the PWR command with parameter Off [0].

Result: Execute PWR with 0 (Off) to turn off the kitchen light.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: NuCore Smart Energy Meter
  ***Properties***
    Current Power
      Range 0 to 10000 Unit Watts (step of 1 and precision of 0).
    Total Energy
      Range 0 to 100000 Unit kWh (step of 0.1 and precision of 1).
    Voltage
      Range 100 to 240 Unit Volts (step of 1 and precision of 0).
    Current
      Range 0 to 50 Unit Amperes (step of 0.1 and precision of 1).
  ***Accept Commands***
    Reset Energy Counter [RESET]
        No parameters.

USER QUERY:
How much total energy has been consumed so far, and can you reset the energy counter?

The device properties include Total Energy measured in kWh with a range from 0 to 100000 and 0.1 step precision. The device also accepts a Reset Energy Counter [RESET] command with no parameters.

Step 1: Retrieve the current Total Energy value to inform the user of the energy consumed so far.
Step 2: If the user wants to reset the counter, send the Reset Energy Counter [RESET] command.

Result: The total energy consumed is the current Total Energy reading in kWh. To reset, execute the RESET command with no parameters.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: NuCore Smart Energy Meter
  ***Properties***
    Current Power
      Range 0 to 10000 Unit Watts (step of 1 and precision of 0).
    Total Energy
      Range 0 to 100000 Unit kWh (step of 0.1 and precision of 1).
    Voltage
      Range 100 to 240 Unit Volts (step of 1 and precision of 0).
    Current
      Range 0 to 50 Unit Amperes (step of 0.1 and precision of 1).
  ***Accept Commands***
    Reset Energy Counter [RESET]
        No parameters.

USER QUERY:
What is the current voltage and current being drawn by the device?

The device properties include Voltage ranging from 100 to 240 volts and Current ranging from 0 to 50 amperes, both with appropriate step sizes and precision.

To answer the user's query, I would retrieve the current Voltage and Current property values from the device.

Result: The current voltage is reported in volts (100-240 V), and the current is reported in amperes (0-50 A) as measured by the device.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

Please reset the energy counter on the meter.

The device accepts a Reset Energy Counter [RESET] command with no parameters.

To reset the energy counter, I will send the RESET command to the device.

Result: Execute RESET command with no parameters to reset the energy counter.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: NuCore Smart Door Lock
  ***Properties***
    Lock State
      Enum
        Locked [1]
        Unlocked [0]
    Battery Level
      Range 0 to 100 Unit Percent (step of 1 and precision of 0).
  ***Accept Commands***
    Lock Door [LOCK]
        No parameters.
    Unlock Door [UNLOCK]
        No parameters.

USER QUERY:
Is the front door locked, and what is the battery level?

The device properties include Lock State with values Locked [1] and Unlocked [0], and Battery Level from 0 to 100 percent.

To answer the user's question, I would check the current Lock State to determine if the door is locked or unlocked, and read the Battery Level property.

Result: The front door is either Locked or Unlocked based on the Lock State property, and the battery level is reported as a percentage between 0 and 100%.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: NuCore Smart Door Lock
  ***Properties***
    Lock State
      Enum
        Locked [1]
        Unlocked [0]
    Battery Level
      Range 0 to 100 Unit Percent (step of 1 and precision of 0).
  ***Accept Commands***
    Lock Door [LOCK]
        No parameters.
    Unlock Door [UNLOCK]
        No parameters.

USER QUERY:
Please unlock the front door.

The device accepts an Unlock Door [UNLOCK] command with no parameters.

To unlock the front door, I will send the UNLOCK command to the device.

Result: Execute UNLOCK command with no parameters to unlock the front door.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: NuCore Smart Door Lock
  ***Properties***
    Lock State
      Enum
        Locked [1]
        Unlocked [0]
    Battery Level
      Range 0 to 100 Unit Percent (step of 1 and precision of 0).
  ***Accept Commands***
    Lock Door [LOCK]
        No parameters.
    Unlock Door [UNLOCK]
        No parameters.

USER QUERY:
Can you lock the front door and tell me the battery percentage?

The device accepts a Lock Door [LOCK] command with no parameters and has a Battery Level property ranging from 0 to 100 percent.

Step 1: Send the LOCK command to lock the front door.
Step 2: Retrieve the Battery Level property to inform the user of the current battery percentage.

Result: Execute LOCK command to lock the door, and report the battery level as a percentage between 0 and 100%.
